intro: Ailanthus blancoi, commonly known as the white-flowered ailanthus, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Simarouba family and is characterized by its distinctive, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are pinnate, with small, lance-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds. Ailanthus blancoi is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight.
